creator: erwin@darcoury.nl
text:
On Windows 2000, Apache 2.2.4 fails to get remote IPs; it reports 0.0.0.0 for 
all connections in the logfiles. The 0.0.0.0 IP is also passed on to PHP 
scripts; which breaks functionality that depend on remote hostsnames and IPs.

This bug is specific in Apache 2.2.4 on Windows 2000; the bug does not appear 
in other Windows versions, nor with any prior version of Apache on Windows 2000.

Log example:
0.0.0.0 - - [23/Feb/2007:00:23:40 +0100] "GET /viewtopic.php?t=379 HTTP/1.1" 
200 21114 "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; Googlebot/2.1; 
+http://www.google.com/bot.html)"
0.0.0.0 - - [23/Feb/2007:00:29:42 +0100] "GET /viewtopic.php?t=433 HTTP/1.1" 
200 17212 "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; Googlebot/2.1; 
+http://www.google.com/bot.html)"
0.0.0.0 - - [23/Feb/2007:00:35:43 +0100] "GET /viewtopic.php?t=365 HTTP/1.1" 
200 15936 "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; Googlebot/2.1; 
+http://www.google.com/bot.html)"
